conbody.p: Let's assume that you want to read all names and account numbers from the Salesforce Account object. The object contains a large number of records, so you choose to use the Salesforce Bulk API. You use the default value of Id for the offset field. You use the default value of 000000000000000 for the offset value to ensure that the origin reads all records in the object.
You define the SOQL query as follows, including the offset field and offset value in the WHERE and ORDER BY clauses as required:
conbody.codeblock: SELECT Id, Name, AccountNumber FROM Account WHERE Id > '${OFFSET}' ORDER BY Id
